column4: http://ohioloco.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=49714 I have a lexmark z615 that GUTSY properly recognizes as a z600, should I use my old howto to install the printer driver?
- i found the old directions to still be true in the latest distro
- though converting the rpm to pkg worked easiest
do you have a more recent howto?
- let me see if i can find the one i used on my lexmark... 2 sec
that would be great... I think there has to be a couple of steps.. like alien or something (used to be)
- yeah you use alien to convert the rpm to a package and then you use dpkg -i to isntall them both, then start up the CUPS and setup your printer
- i did it a couple of weeks ago and it worked for me so you should be good to go
okay, sounds like the same as my old howto, I guess I'll go for it, thanks
- that link i think basically says that, and it should work
what is up with #sudo apt-get install alien asking me to put a disk in?
Media change: please insert the disc labeled
in the drive '/cdrom/' and press enter
- you have your CDROM in your list of repos
